info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 9:01PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN CUSTER...NORTHERN POWDER RIVER AND SOUTHERN ROSEBUD COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM MDT... At 859 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Ashland, or 29 miles southeast of Colstrip, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph, half inch hail and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rainfall will cause a quick and significant drop in visibility, along with ponding of water on roadways, making travel difficult. Locations impacted include... Volborg, Ashland, Olive, Sonnette, Brandenberg, Garland, and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
